campaign.title: Competitive Intelligence
campaign.subject: What your competitors know about you (and what you should know about them)
campaign.description: How to track competitors and learn from their strategies

slides.title: Know Your Competition
slides.narration: Your competitors are watching you. They're tracking your pricing, your promotions, your reviews. They're learning from your successes and your mistakes. The question is: are you watching them? Competitive intelligence isn't spying—it's smart business. Let me show you how to do it right.

slides.title: What to Track

track_items.what: Where they advertise, what they say
Where they show up, how active

slides.narration: What should you track? Pricing—their prices, specials, and discounts. Offerings—new services, products, packages they introduce. Marketing—where they advertise and what messages they use. Reviews—what their customers are saying, good and bad. Presence—where they show up and how active they are. This gives you a complete picture of their strategy.

slides.title: Learning from Reviews

insights.learn: What customers value—can you offer it too?
Where they're weak—can you be strong?
How they handle complaints—can you do better?
What matters most to your shared customers?

slides.narration: Their reviews are your roadmap. Positive reviews show what customers value—can you offer it too? Negative reviews show where they're weak—can you be strong there? Their responses show how they handle complaints—can you do better? Review frequency tells you if they're growing or stagnant. Common themes reveal what matters most to the customers you're both trying to win.

slides.title: Competitive Positioning
slides.narration: Competitive intelligence helps you find your differentiation. Where do competitors cluster? Go where they aren't. What do they all say? Say something different. Where are they weak? Make that your strength. What don't they offer? Fill the gap. Who don't they serve? Specialize for that audience. You don't win by copying—you win by differentiating.

slides.title: Monitor Continuously
slides.narration: Set up ongoing monitoring. Google Alerts for competitor mentions—real-time notifications. Weekly review monitoring across platforms. Follow their social accounts to see their activity. Monthly website checks for pricing and offering changes. Watch the event calendar for their events and promotions. Takes ten minutes a week once it's set up.

slides.title: Your Competitive Audit

audit_steps.action: Note their current pricing and offers
Check where they're visible (directory, events, news)

slides.narration: Here's your competitive audit—takes about thirty minutes. Step one: list your top five competitors. Step two: read their last twenty reviews each. Step three: note their current pricing and offers. Step four: check where they're visible—directory, events, news. Step five: identify three differentiation opportunities. Thirty minutes and you'll know more about your market than most of your competitors know.

slides.title: Get Competitive
slides.narration: Ready to know your market? Run a competitive analysis—we'll pull data on your competitors automatically. Or download the audit template to do it yourself. Knowledge is power. In business, knowing your competition is half the battle.
